name: hit
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move your hand or an object onto the surface of something so that it touches it, usually with force

example.eg: Teachers are not allowed to hit their pupils.
example.egtrans: 不允许教师打学生。

example.eg: This type of glass won't shatter no matter how hard you hit it.
example.egtrans: 这种玻璃无论你怎么敲击都不会碎。

example.eg: She hit her thumb with the hammer.
example.egtrans: 她用锤子砸到自己的拇指。

trans_examp.trans_en: to touch something with sudden force

example.eg: They were going about 60 kilometres an hour when their car hit the tree.
example.egtrans: 他们的车撞到树上时正以约每小时60公里的车速行驶。

example.eg: One journalist was hit in the leg by a stray bullet.
example.egtrans: 一名记者被流弹击中了腿部。

example.eg: That new shelf in the bathroom is too low - I just hit my head on it.
example.egtrans: 浴室里的那个新架子太低——我的头刚刚撞在上面了。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have an unpleasant or negative effect on a person or thing

example.eg: Production has been badly hit by the strike.
example.egtrans: 罢工严重影响了生产。

example.eg: Demand for transatlantic flights has been hit by fears of terrorist attacks.
example.egtrans: 由于害怕遭遇恐怖袭击，人们对飞越大西洋航班的需求受到了影响。

trans_examp.trans_en: If an idea or thought hits you, you suddenly think of it.

example.eg: That's when it hit me that my life would never be the same again.
example.egtrans: 那一刻我忽然明白我的人生再也不会和过去一样了。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to shoot at or bomb a place or person, causing damage or injury

example.eg: Two schools were hit during the air raid.
example.egtrans: 空袭中有两所学校遭到了轰炸。

example.eg: He was hit in the neck by a bullet from a sniper.
example.egtrans: 他被一名狙击手射出的子弹击中了颈部。

example.eg: Try to hit the middle of the target.
example.egtrans: 要尽量打中靶心。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrive at a place or position

example.eg: If we turn left at the next junction, we should hit the main road after five miles or so.
example.egtrans: 如果在下一个路口左转弯，走5英里左右后我们就会抵达大路。

trans_examp.trans_en: to succeed in reaching or achieving something

example.eg: Our profits hit an all-time high of $20 million last year.
example.egtrans: 去年我们的盈利达到了2000万英镑的最高纪录。

example.eg: I just can't hit (= sing) those high notes like I used to.
example.egtrans: 我就是不能像过去一样把那些高音唱上去。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to like someone and become friendly immediately

example.eg: I didn't really hit it off with his friends.
example.egtrans: 我和他的朋友们并不怎么合得来。

example.eg: Jake and Sue hit it off immediately.
example.egtrans: 杰克和苏一见如故。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: Three drug dealers were hit in the city over the weekend.
example.egtrans: 周末有3名毒贩在该市被击毙。

name: hit
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thing or person that is very popular or successful
trans_examp.trans_cn: 非常受欢迎的人（或事）；非常成功的人（或事）

example.eg: The Beatles had a string of number-one hits in the 1960s.
example.egtrans: 20世纪60年代甲壳虫乐队推出了一系列排行榜冠军曲目。

example.eg: Your cake was a real hit at the party - everyone commented.
example.egtrans: 聚会上你的蛋糕真是棒极了——每个人都在谈论。

example.eg: They've just released an album of their greatest hits (= their most successful songs).
example.egtrans: 他们刚刚发行了一张他们的上榜歌曲精选。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a request to use a web page on the internet that is then counted to calculate the number of people looking at the page

example.eg: Our page had 243 hits this week.
example.egtrans: 我们的网页本周的点击数为243次。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of hitting something or someone, or an occasion when something or someone hits you

example.eg: She gave him a hit on the head which knocked him flying.
example.egtrans: 她击中了他的头部，打得他眼冒金星。

trans_examp.trans_en: in baseball, when the batter (= person trying to hit the ball) safely reaches first base after hitting the ball

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when something that has been thrown, dropped, shot, etc. at a place or object reaches that place or object

example.eg: The rebel headquarters took a direct hit from a bomb during the attack.
example.egtrans: 在这次进攻中，一颗炸弹直接击中了叛军的总部。

example.eg: I scored a hit on my second shot.
example.egtrans: 我的第二枪击中了靶心。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: He was the victim of a mafia hit.
example.egtrans: 他是被黑手党谋杀的。
